summary:
Jan joined ING Group in 2001, after graduating with a Master’s Degree in both Economic Law and in Economics from Utrecht University in The Netherlands. 

He held various financial and commercial leadership roles, of which 6 years in Structured Finance in ING and 17 years in various lines of business in Shell. His career developed in the energy sector with finance and commercial assignments in The Netherlands, Hong Kong, Libya, the UAE (Dubai) and the UK.

In 2011, Jan joined Shell's Commercial & NBD Department in Dubai and grew to become Chief Economist for Middle East & North Africa and Senior Commercial Advisor for Iraq. In the latter role, he coordinated various initiatives to enhance & deliver the value potential of the Iraq investment portfolio, including in negotiations with the host government and by optimizing commercial & investment strategies in various world-class projects.

In October 2016, Jan was appointed Deal Delivery Manager, based in London, where he assumed various deal leadership roles, successfully negatiating various new Joint Ventures to rejuvenate Shell’s Upstream portfolio, and designed and rolled out a new, buyer centric global marketing campaign through which various new Upstream Joint Ventures were established. In January 2019 Jan repatriated to the RDS Head Office in The Hague where he continued his role and started a new Deal Delivery team as Team Lead NL. From October 2020 to October 2021, he stood in (a.i.) as the General Manager Commercial & NBD for Global Exploration, leading a global team of ~10 commercial professionals based in London, The Hague and Houston. 

Currently Jan is a snr deal maker in Shell’s central “Corporate M&A & Deal Execution” department, where he leads and advises on a wide variety of strategic transactions and commercial projects.

Jan, a Dutch citizen, is married to Anouk and has a daughter and a son. He enjoys travelling with his family, participating in team activities and staying fit through running and boxing.

profile_positions.description:
The Commercial Team, located in London, is responsible for globally acquiring coveted new Upstream licenses in alignment with the Group strategy, and to actively manage existing Upstream positions to high-grade the exploration portfolio.

The Deal Delivery Manager is responsible for delivering growth and portfolio opportunities through Shell's global opportunity realization process; from initial framing and deal-setup until commercial deal closure, leading multi-disciplinary virtual project teams and managing all internal and external interfaces of the opportunity.

Jan assumed various deal leadership roles, a role as venture manager, and designed and implemented a new, buyer centric marketing approach for farming out exploration licenses.

profile_positions.description:
1. Senior Commercial Advisor
Senior advisor on investment strategies, negotiations and portfolio optimization for Shell's integrated business portfolio in Iraq. In this role Jan advised on investment decisions, framed and optimized investment & negotiation strategies, and provided general commercial support to ongoing business & financial issues. For example, Jan was the commercial lead for negotiating a field development plan of a 50 bln barrel oil field in Southern Iraq. 

2. Chief Economist for the MENA region
Coordinated a team of ~10 regional economists through 'dotted' line as well as supervisor relationships: ensured functional excellence in the MENA region through ad-hoc coaching and support, designing learning & development paths for economists and by providing functional assurance & sign off on investment proposals ("technical authority, TA1").

Managed, as Iraq Lead Economist, the timely delivery of fit-for-purpose economic intelligence by a dedicated team of 4 economists supporting investment decisions, negotiation strategies, business planning & capital budgeting submissions, etc. 

Jan was also a member of the Upstream MENA NBD Leadership Team, the Iraq Finance Leadership Team, the Iraq Tender Board and of the Upstream Commercial Leadership Forum.
